sermons.sermon_title: "The Lord Is King For Ever And Ever" Psalm 10:16

occurrences.context: control. Can I tell you this? There are some times I believe with all my heart that sometimes a way, a way, that God judges a nation is through its leadership. So how do I cope? What are some biblical principles? Number one, let me give you this verse. I'll share some things here in just a moment, but let me give you a couple of verses. Psalm 75, verses 6 and 7. For promotion cometh neither from the east nor from the west nor from the south. But God is the judge. Notice this. He putteth down one and setteth up another. So really it comes down to this. Do we believe the Bible? Do we believe these verses of Scripture? Do we believe that God's in control? Let me remind you of Daniel 4 and verse 17. The Bible says this matter is by the decree of the watchers and the demand by the word of the holy ones to the intent that the living may know. What is it that the living may know? That the Most High ruleth in the kingdom of men and giveth it to whomsoever He will and setteth up over it the basest of men. The question is do we believe the Bible? He said in Daniel 4, 17 that the living may know. As far as I know, we're all still alive here this morning. And that the living may know what? That the Most High ruleth in the kingdom
